alert.note: Alert for Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Wind River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 08 at 2:09PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF OWL CREEK AND BRIDGER MOUNTAINS...WIND RIVER BASIN...AND SOUTHWEST BIG HORN BASIN... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of 30 to 40 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 208 PM MST, a band of heavy snow was 12 miles north of Boysen State Park, or 12 miles south of Thermopolis moving southeast at 25 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Shoshoni, Lysite, Boysen State Park and Bonneville. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&

area.areaDesc: Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Wind River Basin
